title: Light Rail Transit
description: Light Rail Transit (LRT) is a rail system that uses electricity to power the train. It is a form of mass transit that is used in urban areas.

title: Vehicles Mile Travelled
description: Vehicles Mile Travelled (VMT) is a measure of the total distance travelled by all vehicles in a given area over a given period of time.

title: Mass Rapid Transit
description: Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) is a rail system that uses electricity to power the train. It is a form of mass transit that is used in urban areas.

title: Bus Rapid Transit
description: Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) is a bus system that uses dedicated lanes to provide faster and more reliable service. It is a form of mass transit that is used in urban areas.

title: Transit Oriented Development
description: Transit Oriented Development (TOD) is a type of urban development that maximizes the amount of residential, business and leisure space within walking distance of public transport.

title: Mixed Use Development
description: Mixed Use Development is a type of urban development that combines residential, business and leisure space in a single building or complex.

title: Closed Streets
description: Closed Streets are streets that are closed to motorized traffic. They are often used for pedestrian and bicycle traffic.

title: Bike Lanes
description: Bike Lanes are lanes on the road that are reserved for bicycles. They are often separated from the rest of the road by a physical barrier.

title: Robert Moses
description: Robert Moses was a city planner who was responsible for the construction of many of New York City's highways and bridges. He was also responsible for the construction of many of New York City's public housing projects.

title: Jane Jacobs
description: Jane Jacobs was a city planner who was responsible for the construction of many of New York City's highways and bridges. She was also responsible for the construction of many of New York City's public housing projects.

title: Vision Zero
description: Vision Zero is a road safety initiative that aims to reduce the number of traffic fatalities to zero by 2024.

title: High Density
description: High Density is a type of urban development that maximizes the amount of residential, business and leisure space within walking distance of public transport.
